In Workbench 5's Plugin Manager you can view registered plugins and add new plugins. Plugins are shown with their publisher, version number, description (if available), and assembly name. 


![wb5_plugin_manager.png](wb5_plugin_manager.png)


All Workbench plugins are contained within Dynamic Link Libraries (DLLs). You can add plugins to Workbench by selecting the desired DLL on your machine or network.


**To add plugins to Workbench,**







**Note:** Your desired plugin must be located in a subdirectory of the chosen directory.



1. Click ![wb5_more_icon.png](wb5_more_icon.png) in the left-hand icon bar.
2. Click **Plugins**in the **More** pane. (If you do not see this pane, click ![wb5_hide_subtab_icon.png](wb5_hide_subtab_icon.png) to expand it.)  
   
 The **Plugin Manager** opens.
3. Under "Register new plugins," click the ellipsis (...) next to the **Search path**field.  
   
 ![wb5_register_plugin.png](wb5_register_plugin.png)
4. On your machine or network, locate and open the DLL containing the plugins you want to add.
5. Click **Add** after you have chosen your directory.
